action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ X X ▢ ▢
X X X X X
▢ X X ▢ ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢

DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square with a central cross pattern. The third row is entirely filled with X's. The second and fourth rows have X's in the second, third, and fourth positions. The first and fifth rows have an X only in the third position. The rest of the grid is empty (▢).

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X X ▢ X X
X ▢ X ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X
X ▢ ▢ ▢ X

DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square with "X" and "▢" symbols. The first row has "X" in the first and last positions, with "▢" in between. The second row has "X" in all positions except the third, which is "▢". The third row alternates "X" and "▢", starting and ending with "X". The fourth and fifth rows have "X" in the first and last positions, with "▢" in between.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The grid is a 5x5 square with a central cross pattern. The third row is entirely filled with X's. The second and fourth rows have X's in the second, third, and fourth positions. The first and fifth rows have an X only in the third position. The rest of the grid is empty (▢).
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In the first row, is there an "X" in the first and last positions?
